roleset.name: make organized again, resorting, restruucturing
roleset.note: REORGANIZE-V NOTES: Comparison with 'create'. Member of Vncls create-26.4-1. (from reorganize.01-v)
REORGANIZATION-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, reorganize.01. Corresponds to VNcls create-26.4-1 (from reorganization.01-n)

roles.note: arg5 added due to nominal usage (from reorganization.01-n)

role.descr: specific aspect of arg1 that is being reorganized

example.name: intransitive
example.text: Several Big Board firms are organizing to complain about program trading and the exchange's role in it.
example.arg: to complain about program trading and the exchange's role in it

example.name: transitive
example.text: Mr. Fournier said that as Navigation Mixte chairman, he-1 is prohibited [*trace*-1]-2 by takeover regulations from *trace*-2 reorganizing his own defense or doing anything besides managing current company business.

example.name: one kind of end state
example.text: The figures exclude businesses-1 now reorganized *trace*-1 as American Express Information Services Co.
example.arg: as American Express Information Services Co

example.name: clearer start and end states
example.text: John reorganized his desk from a full-blown disaster area into a tidy collection of piles.
example.arg: into a tidy collection of piles

example.name: arg1
example.text: Labour could n't do enough NHS reorganisation .

example.name: args 1 and 5
example.text: The economic reorganization of the military sector at the beginning of the twenty-first century.
example.arg: at the beginning of te twenty-first century
